subject: Economics
title: Matching Markets: Who Gets What and Why
description: Learn Matching Markets: Who Gets What and Why in one minute.

hook.text: Every year, 40,000 medical students are matched to hospitals through an algorithm designed by a Nobel laureate.

buildup.text: Some markets can't use prices: organ donation, school assignment, residency matching.

discovery.text: Alvin Roth designed matching algorithms that produce 'stable' outcomes.

twist.text: Roth also redesigned New York City's school choice system.

climax.text: Matching theory shows that well-designed algorithms can replace prices in allocating scarce resources fairly and.

punchline.text: The best markets don't use money. They use smart design.

quiz.question: What problem does the matching algorithm solve in medical residency?
options: Creating stable matches where no hospital-student pair would prefer to leave their assignment for each other
